biospec_descr.textblock: 7.5 ml of EDTA blood, 7.5 ml of serum

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the PsyCo Study is to determine whether psychological Stress has an influence on
      copeptin levels.

clinical_study.brief_title: Copeptin During a Standardized Psychological Stress Test

detailed_description.textblock:
healthy volunteers undergo the TSST and stress hormones as cortisol and copeptin are
      measured

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        •Aged over 18 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Intake of any kind of medication (except birth control pill)

          -  BMI >30 kg/m2

          -  Evidence of any acute illness

          -  History of chronic illness

          -  Baseline glucose level >7 mmol/l Baseline sodium level <135 mmol/l or >145 mmol/l

clinical_study.official_title: Copeptin During a Standardized Psychological Stress Test

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in copeptin levels after a psychological stress test
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30min before, at time point 0, +10, +20, +40, +60 after the psychological stress test

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
